Module kivakit.resource
Package com.telenav.kivakit.resource

Class ResourceGlob

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.resource.ResourceGlob
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matchable<ResourcePathed>, Matcher<ResourcePathed>
public class ResourceGlob extends Object implements Matcher<ResourcePathed>
A resource "glob" is similar to a file glob in UNIX. It matches resources, according to one or more patterns, which can be combined with logical operators.

Patterns

Glob patterns are case-sensitive Java regular expressions where just three symbols are re-defined: 

     ** - matches anything, including slashes
      * - matches anything, except a slash
      . - matches a literal dot

For example, "**/target/**.class" would match each of these resources:

  • my-project/target/MyApp.class
  • my-project/my-sub-project/target/MyApp.class
  • my-project/my-sub-project/target/com/me/MyApp.class

Creating Globs

ResourceGlobs can be created with the match*() static factory methods:

  • match(Matcher) - Creates a glob that matches resources with the given Matcher
  • match(Pattern) - Creates a glob that matches resources with the given Java regular expression Pattern
  • match(String) - Creates a glob that matches resources with the given glob pattern (as described above)
  • matchAll() - Creates a glob that matches all resources
  • matchAllIn(ResourceFolder) - Creates a glob that matches all resources directly in the given folder
  • matchAllUnder(ResourceFolder) - Creates a glob that matches all resources in the given folder, and in all sub-folders, recursively

Logical Operations

Boolean logical operators are provided for combining globs:

  • in(ResourceFolder) - Matches what this matches, but only if it's in the given ResourceFolder
  • minus(Matchable) - Matches what this glob matches, but without what the given Matcher matches
  • not() - Matches everything this does not match
  • plus(Matchable) - Matches what this matches, plus what the given Matcher matches
  • select(Matchable) - Matches what this and> the given Matcher both match
  • under(ResourceFolder) - Matches what this matches, but only if it's under the given ResourceFolder

Examples

 match(Extension.JAVA)                         // Match .java resources
 match(JAVA)                                   // Match .java resources
 match("**.java")                              // Match .java resources
 match(JAVA).not()                             // Match all but .java resources
 match(JAVA).plus(MARKDOWN)                    // Match .java and .md resources
 match(JAVA).minus(it -> it.endsWith("Test"))  // Match .java resources except tests
 match("**/target/**").select(CLASS)           // Match class files under target
 match(CLASS).under(target)                    // Match class files under target
 matchAllUnder(target).select(CLASS)           // Match class files under target
 match(JAVA).plus(target)                      // Match .java and target files

jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Details

    • match

      public static ResourceGlob match(Matchable<ResourcePathed> matchable)
      Returns a glob that matches resources with the Matcher provided by the given Matchable. For example, the Extension class is Matchable<ResourcePathed>, which allows it to be passed to this method to select resources: 
       match(Extension.JAVA)
 match(file.extension())
      Parameters:
      matchable - The source of a matcher
      Returns:
      The glob

    • match

      public static ResourceGlob match(Pattern pattern)
      Returns a glob that matches resources with the given regular expression pattern. For example: 
       match(Pattern.compile("[a-z]+[0-9]*"))
      Parameters:
      pattern - The pattern to match
      Returns:
      The glob

    • match

      public static ResourceGlob match(String glob)
      Returns a glob that matches resources with the given pattern. The pattern is a regular expression, with these differences applied: 
        ** - matches anything, including slashes
   * - matches anything, except a slash
   . - matches a literal dot

      Glob patterns are case-sensitive.

      Parameters:
      glob - The pattern to match
      Returns:
      The glob

    • match

      public static ResourceGlob match(Matcher<ResourcePathed> matcher)
      Returns a glob for the given matcher
      Parameters:
      matcher - The matcher
      Returns:
      The glob

    • matchAll

      public static ResourceGlob matchAll()
      Returns a resource glob that matches all resources

    • matchAllIn

      public static ResourceGlob matchAllIn(ResourceFolder<?> folder)
      Returns a glob that matches all resources under the given folder
      Parameters:
      folder - The folder that resources must be under (recursively)
      Returns:
      The glob
